Description: Fine, wheel-made ceramic vessel of in Nile silt with copious calcium carbonate temper.Rolled rim, slightly convex walls tapering to a smaller flat base. Vertically burnished inside and horizontally outside. Good condition.
Curator's comments: Cf. W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Ceremonial Slate Palettes and Corpus of Protodynastic Pottery’ (London, 1953), 33l-k. Bibliography: F. Ll. Griffith, 'Liverpool Annals of Archaeology and Anthropology 8 (Liverpool, 1921), 13.
